person.note: Lv Huiqing [1309] His youngest brother was Liangqing [3650]. Yan's [1330] grandnephew, Heqing's [1302] Shengqing's [1323],and Wenqing's [1329] elder brother, Yuan's [1332] uncle, Fang(1) Xijue's [3296] brother-in-law (see Fujian TZ, 147.22b). Affinal relation of Fang(1) Ze [602]. Xu(3) Xi's [753] patron. Elder brother of Guo(1) Fu's [7269] wife. His great grandnephew, Jing [3646], was appointed to a supervisory post in the Raozhou mint in 1158. When Huiqing met Wang(2) Anshi [1762], they aggreed on the interpretation of the classics and Wang(2) Anshi became his patron (SS[PRC], 471.13706). Yang(2) Wei(2)'s [2032] patron. Lu(9) Cong [1328] has the same generational name as his sons and nephews. XCB, 211.10b, 215.1b,227.2b (n.), 3b (n.), 245.21a, 246.17a, 249.2a, 9b, 250.2a, 251.11b, 252.21b, 254.11a, 16b, 269.14b-15a; XCBSB, 1.26b, 5b, 5.21b (n.); XNYL, 180.9b; SHY:ZG, 26.3b, 42.62a; SHY:SH, 56.17a; SS, 471.9b. Fujian TZ, 147.19b has him listed without kin in exactly the same way that Cai Jing's ancestry was treated even though his father, Shou, was jinshi in 1024. SS(PRC), 471.13706. CBD, 2, 1218-9.
